com.example.diningapp

Class Cafe

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.diningapp.Eatery
      • com.example.diningapp.Cafe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Eatery>

    public class Cafe
extends Eatery
    This class is an eatery, an instance representation of a store, cafe, or other non-dining hall eatery on Cornell campus. A master list of these is created and stored in the MasterEateryList class, and can be used by the main program to access information about Cafes. This class extends Eatery - see Eatery class for more info
    Author:
    James Stoyell

      • SINGLE_DAY_PATTERN

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern SINGLE_DAY_PATTERN
        The pattern to match a single day's times in the hours string

        Group 0: The entire string

        Group 1: The day of week string

        Group 2: The start block hours

        Group 3: The start block minutes

        Group 4: THe start block AM/PM

        Group 5: The end block hours

        Group 6: The end block minutes

        Group 7: The end block AM/PM

      • DAY_RANGE_PATTERN

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern DAY_RANGE_PATTERN
        The pattern to match a range of days in the hours string

        Group 0: The entire string

        Group 1: Start day string

        Group 2: End day string

        Group 3: The start block hours

        Group 4: The start block minutes

        Group 5: THe start block AM/PM

        Group 6: The end block hours

        Group 7: The end block minutes

        Group 8: The end block AM/PM

      • getTimeInMinutes

        private int getTimeInMinutes(java.lang.String hours,
                   java.lang.String minutes,
                   java.lang.String period)
        Calculates the number of minutes since the start of the day given the parameters passed in
        Parameters:
        hours - The hours digits as if on a digital clock - Must be 12 or less
        minutes - The minutes digits as if on a digital clock - Must be less that 60
        period - AM or PM, the period of the day
        Returns:
        Number of minutes since the start of the day
